articles.title: Watch the world through different animals' eyes in this stunning high-tech footage - Livescience.com
articles.description: Cameras recorded footage in red, blue, green and UV channels simultaneously, with openly available software processing the raw footage and converting it into different kinds of "animal vision," showing us how bees, birds, mice and dogs might see the world.
articles.content:
Scientists have combined a new camera system with open-source software to generate stunning video clips of the world as different animals see it — including the specific colors they perceive.
